results.title: Jabberwocky
results.creator_credit: Terry Gilliam, Sandy Lieberson and Umbrella Entertainment
results.brief_description: A Monty Python splinter faction is responsible for this medieval farce of hysterical proportions. Based on the Lewis Carroll play of the same name, the monster of the title doesn’t appear until the final minutes but it is worth the wait as it is a work of inspired dark imagination. Set in the Middle Ages in England, Michael Palin plays a bumpkin son of a country cooper who goes to the city to seek his fortune after the death of his father. The land in which he lives is terrorised by the monster who attacks travellers who pass through it’s forest. Palin becomes the inadvertent hero, chosen to slay the monster and win the hand of the fair princess. Full of dark humour and even darker ambience, this is not a film for the squeamish!

results.title: Jaara Nyilamum
results.creator_credit: Lou Bennett AM and Romaine Moreton
results.credit_line:
Dr Romaine Moreton (Goenpul Yagerabul Minjungbal Bundjalung) and Dr Lou Bennett AM (Dja Dja Wurrung, Yorta Yorta)

Single-channel video, 7.39 mins

Filmed and edited by Dr Romaine Moreton

Co-directed by Dr Romaine Moreton and Dr Lou Bennett AM

Jaara Nyilamum (song composition) Performed by Dr Lou Bennett AM and the Australian String Quartet

Composed by Dr Lou Bennett AM

Arranged by Iain Grandage

Produced by Stephen Snelleman

Engineered by Russell Thomson

ACMI Collection
results.brief_description:
“The making of “Jaara Nyilamum” (2021) evoked a stillness that restored us to full sensual immersion within Country, and from this place of rooted calmness, Country reaffirmed our Law is real. “Jaara Nyilamum” became most profound when we realised this was more than a film about ceremony, but was in fact, ceremony itself. Our challenge was to create a production model that aligned with our beliefs and centralised our Law, pushed back against monochronic time and engaged with the deep cycles of place, where we embraced Belonging as a process of constant renewal and Rematration.” – Dr Lou Bennett AM and Dr Romaine Moreton

Dr Lou Bennett is a performer, songwriter, musical and artistic director, composer, actor, soundscape designer and academic. Lou’s research project ‘Sovereign Language Rematriation Through Song Pedagogy’ focusses on the importance and relevance of Indigenous language retrieval, reclamation, and regeneration through the medium of the arts to enhance community health and wellbeing.

Dr Romaine Moreton is an artist, writer, performer, filmmaker, and her proposes an Indigenous philosophy of storytelling and embodied knowledge, with her work constantly drawing our attention back to the importance of the breath in Indigenous cultural practices.

results.title: Master of the house = Du skal aere din hustru: thou shalt honour thy wife
results.creator_credit: Carl Theodor Dreyer and Palladium Films
results.brief_description: Since the collapse of his business, Victor (Meyer) has grown increasingly morose, ill tempered, selfish and demanding. Unaware of the plight of his wife and three children to keep the family fed and clothed, Victor persists in treating his wife harshly, and her health deteriorates. To aid her recovery, Victor’s wife is sent away from the home duties that have burdened her for so long. In exchange, Victor’s old nanny moves in, and treating him as if he was the age when she initially cared for him, shows him the path towards self recognition and amends his cruel ways. Cast includes Johannes Meyer, Astrid Holm, Mathilde Nielson and Clara Schonfeld.

results.title: The Divine Mozart
results.creator_credit: Andrew Forrester, Jeremy Bugler, Channel Four and Fulmar
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “J’accuse”.
Nicholas Kenyon presents a critical look at the life and work of Mozart, exposing some of the myths that surround the famous composer. He rejects the notion of a saintly genius, who sacrificed himself for his art and died a pauper. When considered in the context of the historical period he lived in, Mozart emerges as a more “down to earth”, practical composer, who wrote music for money. The program includes comments from authorities in the music world and explores the reasons for Mozart’s popular appeal.

results.title: Citizen Kane by Robert McKee
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnstone, Channel 4 and Fulman Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “J’accuse”.
Contrary to the traditional stance of acclaiming “Citizen Kane” as one of the greatest films of all time, Robert McKee, in this critical lecture on the film, believes that “Citizen Kane” has few of the attributes of great art. McKee believes that the style of the piece “jumps off the screen and applauds itself” while style and content fight each other. Welles’ is seen as a manipulator of the audience’s response, using cinematic techniques which saturate the film with visual metaphor. Importantly, McKee’s analysis sees a fundamental weakness in the plot and characterisation of the film, highighting the conflict Welles had with writer Herman Mankiewicz over the inclusion of the “Rosebud” plot as an example of this. McKee urges the viewer to see beyond the mythology of “Citizen Kane.”

results.title: Once upon a time in China II
results.creator_credit: Tsui Hark, Film Workshop and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: Although not as bleak as the first in the series, the conflict between cultures and the rapidly changing values of the late 19th. century is the theme of this martial arts film starring asian champion Jet Lee. He clings to tradition in a China weakened by the invasion of imperialist forces while others like Sun Yat-Sen adapt to the change. There is plenty of hair-raising action and the final showdown in the Temple of the White Lotus will amaze. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time in America
results.creator_credit: Sergio Leone, Arnon Milchan and Embassy International Pictures
results.brief_description: Crime, passion and a lust for power - an explosive saga of gangland America. Its extraordinary craftsmanship, together with its exceptional levels of acting and storytelling, place it among such other R-rated classics as “The Deerhunter”, “The Godfather”, “Midnight Express” and “A Clockwork Orange”. Stars Robert de Niro, James Woods, Elizabeth McGovern, Danny Aiello, Joe Pesci and Tuesday Weld.

results.title: Van Gogh
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnstone, Channel Four and Fulmar
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “J’accuse”.
Was Vincent Van Gogh a genius or a clumsy amateur? Art historian, Griselda Pollock presents a critical and provocative look at the life and work of this celebrated artist and examines some of the myths. Van Gogh is popularly perceived as a tragic but inspirational figure who was unappreciated during his life, but has since become one of the most famous artists of all time. Pollock tries to separate the facts from the legend and shows how powerful mass media and the art market have been in shaping our attitude towards art and artists.
